answers.answer: I honestly would just have water and toast. With nothing on it. I had mine three weeks ago and failed my one hour and just took my three hour and hoping I passed since I fast for 10 hours.

I took mine in the afternoon after being at work all day.. i had breakfast lunch and a snack. I passed. The nurse said not to eat anything sugary so i avoided my cereal and the candy on my desk :p i would have peanut butter but maybe not the jelly. Good luck!

If you fast  (at least 2 hours before) it will give you a more accurate reading, but at least stay away from high carb/sugary foods and drinks before hand. I did fast and was diagnosed with gestational diabetes due to extremely high blood sugars (they wanted 140 I was at almost 300) and they didn't move on to the 3 hour test. So if you have it, you have it and then you just have to learn how to manage it.
How far do you have to be to have the glucose test done
I'm scheduled next week for mine.  I was told I could eat proteins only the day of testing.
I would go with mainly proteins. Limit the carbs and cut the sugar.
24-28 weeks. I just did mine at 24 weeks. I was told absolutely nothing but water before my test.

question: So my 1 hour gd test is tomorrow..hoping I pass. The doctor didn't really give me any instructions other than not to have my morning soda.  Can I still eat normal or do I need to fast I know If I don't have something somewhat sweet in the morning I get really nauseas and sweaty and light headed. So I'm thinking I will just try to sleep in really late have a peanut butter and jelly sandwhich a couple hours before and then go straight there.
title: gd testing tomorrow
